text: John Percival Bromfield (1886-1947), was a male English international table tennis player. ==Table tennis career== He won a bronze medal at the 1926 World Table Tennis Championships in the men's team event. He was the English Champion in 1903-04 and again in 1923-24 and invented the flick-stroke, the foundation of the modern attacking He also won two English Open titles. Bromfield ran the table tennis club in which Charlie Bull learnt to play. ==See also== * List of England players at the World Team Table Tennis Championships * List of World Table Tennis Championships medalists ==References== Category:1886 births Category:1947 deaths Category:World Table Tennis Championships medalists Category:English male table tennis players
title: Percival Bromfield
